title: Average Hotel in a great location!!
text:
I along with my parents stayed at Gulf Hotel, Colaba for one night in a triple bed room. Chose this hotel given its location and so called good reviews. The hotel is located in an old building like most budget/midrange hotels of South Mumbai. It essentially starts from the 4th floor which is accessed by a tiny lift (max 2 full grown adults capacity excluding lift man). The check in was smooth and staff starting from the ever smiling liftman to the receptionist are courteous. However, the rooms are small, poorly lit and claustrophobic. Bathroom which is even smaller stinks. Only 1 bottle (250ml) drinking water per person is provided. Room service is lazy and quality of food is average. Food orders take ages to get delivered. Dinner consisting of simple dal chawal, egg curry, etc ordered at 9.45 pm was delivered at 11.30 pm and that too after repeated reminders. The only reason to stay in this hotel is it's location being close to the Gateway of India and Taj Hotel. The neighborhood has a touristy vibe and evenings are pleasant. 
In short, I would stop just short of recommending this place. I would suggest a bit more research and adding a few extra bucks per night to book a better place in the immediate vicinity.

title: Good for individuals or couples; not as family friendly with young children as advertised
text:
The hotel is clean, service is fantastic, and continental breakfast was amazing.

We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite: mini fridge, sink, desk, TV, and 2 chairs in the common area; bed, TV, closet, and bathroom in the bedroom. Space is good for a couple or family with 1 child. We had 2 young children and it felt a little cramped for us. We booked a room with a king bed; the reality was a full bed. We asked if there was a room with a larger bed and were told this was the largest bed they had in the hotel. The bed was very comfortable to sleep on and big enough for me and our 2 young kids. We had to request a rollaway bed for my husband, which was an additional 800 rupees ($10 USD) per night. Water pressure in the shower was good, however, the door didn't close all the way and some water would escape into the bathroom. A/C was a very welcome greeting after being out during the day. The only downside was that we would get wafts of cigarette smoke, exhaust, and food smells from the restaurant.

Overall, we had a good stay and I would stay again, making sure to book additional or adjoining rooms for our family of 4.

title: Average hotel, but good location, good for short stay.
text:
I booked a Standard OAK room during July 2017
Pros
1. Nice location, Brigade road and MG Road are the most happening places.
2. Commercial street and all shopping locations nearby, theatre too.
3. Hotel staff very cooperative, straight forward. Manager was good.
4. The wall portraits were good outside the room, in hallway stairs etc

Cons
1. Complimentary food No buffet, instead they give boxed idlis etc to the room.
2. Rooms are small, I have seen 3-4 rooms. Deluxe rooms are slightly bigger, still small as per my view.
3. Hot water never came during my stay of 2 days 1 night. There could be some problem. They say they have switched on the boiler, even I waited 20 mins and flushed all the cold water i could, but no use. Finally bathe in cold water only.
4. The room lights were flickering which was corrected after complaint. I saw flickering lights in 3 places.
5. For 3rd person accommodation they give only mattress and put it on room floor. The mattress was very hard and no space tom move around after putting it. Not able to open restroom door also.
6. I asked for room migration to deluxe but they could not do it since all rooms are full.
7. The guest room in basement floor had broken full size mirror.
8. TV was very small.
9. No lifts, some construction going on.
10. Wifi was not working in First Floor. i stayed in 107. Its working in 2nd floor and ground floor. it says wifi password invalid. but receptionist says that password is only correct. some problem he dont know. He suggested to sit in reception sofa and browse :(
11. Some building work still goes on on 2nd floor it seems, not neat and clean. Truly not TREEBO experience.
12. The way outside rooms are flooded with cigarette smell. Even the bathrooms are little smelly, but they said they will apply room spray and asked us to keep the bathroom door open for 10-15 mins.
13. At 10 o clock itself they started calling me asking me to check out in 1 hr. I felt bad about that, A gentle reminder should be enough instead of severe push for check out. I checked out around 11:10, the guy was not even ready to entertain 11:30, he said guests are waiting, when went downstairs I could see no one.

My wife and cousin and felt very bad about this hotel, certainly not TREEBO need lots of improvement. I feel like OK type for a budget hotel.

I paid 1856 for 3 ppl and one night stay. TREEBO gave 400 rs off. So nice bet for Brigade Road stay,

I feel this hotel is OK but need improvement, may be in few months they will get stabilized.

title: Gulf Hotel in Colaba Mumbai
text:
Das Gulf Hotel ist gerade neben dem Radio Club in Colaba Mumbai. Nicht zu verwechseln mit dem Hotel Gulf…..das 500 Meter weiter weg ist.Die Taxifahrer verwechseln es immer, daher einfach den Radio Club nennen somit kommt man am richtigen Hotel an. Der Eingang zum Hotel ist mit vielen arabischen Menschen umsammelt und rund ums Hotel befinden sich arabische Geschäfte. Die Touristen aus diesen "saudi" arabischen Ländern steigen gerne hier ab. Die Reception ist im 3 Stock (es hat einen Fahrstuhl mit Portier). Achtung einige Zimmer haben kein Fenster. Auch für ein Mittelklass Hotel ist zu bemängeln dass Warmwasser nicht immer vorhanden ist. Das Gebäude selber ist in einem etwas bedürftigen Zustand. wie auch die Zimmer. Zudem ist die Wäsche nicht über alle Zweifel erhaben. Die Zimmerboys bringen Ihnen was man bestellt, rund um die Ihr. Sie schlafen oft in den Aufenthaltsräumen vom Hotel. Of kann man sich nächtelang mit ihnen unterhalten. Fliessend englisch wird gesprochen. Für einen Zimmerpreis ab 40 Euros für ein Einzelzimmer sollte man mehr verlangen können.
Hingegen läuft die Klimaanlage perfekt.

text:
